Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 3star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Hambiz
Reviews.Content: Arrived here for a 2 nights stop before we fly to our next destination and found out that the 3star hotel mentioning in various websites, is just a low end hotel with a good location. Too expensive for what it offers... Definitely not a 3 stars hotel and definitely doesn't worth the 100 uk pounds per night...

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: crossiex
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights 22 March to 26 March. First impression was quite good, the reception staff being very helpful. However the nightmare had yet to begin. The room was at the bottom of the building and although we had booked a double room the size of the bed was NOT a double, more like a three quarter, being pushed against a wall. There was no room for two people to access the room at the same time and the ensuite was just a joke. First day breakfast was okay but Saturday was a disaster. All free tables were cluttered with dirty crockery so we had to clean this away. There were no clean plates so people were using saucers to have their breakfast on, this consequently meant that there were no saucers for the cups. There is only one waitress and she was totally out of her depth. I cannot argue that the location of the hotel is very good but I will definitely not be staying there again and likewise would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrmoose1
Reviews.Content: Great location a couple of minutes walk from Paddingdon station. All the staff are very polite and helpfull. Down side is the size of the bedrooms and unsuites. Our room was so tiny that the bed was pushed against the window to allow room to get to the unsuite which ment you could hear all the traffic noise. The unsuite has to be the smallest I have ever come across, less than 1mx1.5m.

Reviews.Title: “A step up from a hostel for like tripe the price!”
Reviews.Author: 50312girl
Reviews.Content: This place is exactly what the title says. I stayed in a room for 4 people, but the room truely should fit a queen sized bed with a little room left. Not a queen and 2 twins. The bathroom is a tiny step up from an airplane bathroom. The shower is an inch lower than the bathroom itself. The window looks out onto the gas for the hotel. The breakfest is small. Ask the staff for some toast. The location though is fantastic. Located a street down from paddington, you can get anywhere. There are many cafès around for a coffee, local places for unique food and items, and fast food for the picky people. In short, as a crash pad, this place would be good, but to actually use it, trying the hotel across from it, hotel indigo, might go better!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Haf88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 2 nights with 2 friends. We had a triple room which was fine- 3 single beds and a tiny bathroom. Breakfast was included served from 7-9, we arrived downstairs at 8.45 to find no clean table to sit at, a very rude waitress who was most upset that we had arrived downstairs "late" (it was 8.45!!!). When we asked for some more orange juice we were told that we couldn't because "breakfast is over". We did get some 'toast' if you can call it that (I would say warm bread). Cooked breakfast had all gone and they certainly weren't going to make us anymore. The next morning was similar even though we arrived downstairs at 8.30!! We paid for breakfast so that is what we should of had.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the Tin !”
Reviews.Author: ribs160379
Reviews.Content: For the Price you can not fault it. It was clean the B'Fast was included and OK. It served a purpose and I would stay here again. It was nothing special and I would not be using it for anything other than Business when staying on my own or a weekend with mates. Would not be taking the Missus here !

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and shabby”
Reviews.Author: Dolores2107
Reviews.Content: The only thing we enjoyed at this hotel was the location. It is 10 min walk from the Oxford Street, Lancaster Gate and Paddington tube are also very close. However, the rooms are very small and the bathroom is so tiny that your feet stick out when you are sitting on a toilet. What a stupid feeling. The furniture, the bed, the carpet - so shabby. The breakfast is awful! It is from 7 - 9 h and they serve only "traditional English breakfast" which means that you have to eat greasy bacon and beans before 8.30 h in the morning... And the price wasn't low at all! Around 90 pounds per night and you get nothing for it... Unfortunalty London hotels are all so expensive that this was a good rate. Overall, a disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were pretty happy with the hotel and wouldn't mind staying there again. Location: Really close to Paddington station and many bus services. Also an easy walk through Hyde park to some museums/attractions, and to the start of Oxford st for shopping. Perfect. Rooms (and all that): The room was big enough for us to sleep and have our clothes spread a bit. The shower is tiny, so without being funny, if you're a rather large person you might have some issues with this. We were on the 4th floor so noise was no problem and after walking a lot around London, we slept quite well each night, although the walls are thin (you can hear other people sneeze and when everyone is going to breakfast in the morning). Cleanliness/service/communication: This was our one really problem, and the reason for 3 stars instead of 4 overall. The case around the flush button on our toilet was off as it had been broken previously, meaning we had to reach in and pull the leaver manually (not all that clean, and the open case caused a mildly unpleasant odour). We asked for someone to look into it during the day. At night, it wasn't fixed so we asked another reception staff, who had no communication with the first receptionist about the issue, to look into it again. The next afternoon, we followed up again with the first receptionist and were told it couldn't be fixed before our stay ended. The broken case/flush itself was a mild inconvenience, it was that we needed to follow up a few times instead of being informed from the start of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Steven C
Reviews.Content: The front desk reception people are friendly and helpful. Rooms and breakfast dining area are clean. The hotel lift is helpful for higher aged customers!

Reviews.Title: “A very affordable option”
Reviews.Author: Tiemileal
Reviews.Content: Well in my opinion Castleton hotel fulfils all your basic needs, dont go there expecting a luxurious room or an american standard size room cause you will get disappointed. I stayed at castleton hotel for a week with my parents (3 people) and we reserved the quadruple room. We stayed at the lowest floor (the basement) and from what I've read in Tripadvisor the basement rooms were suppose to be very noisy.. but to be honest nothing bothered me at all (my room was next door to the breakfast room, like literally beside the breakfast room) and in all the 6 nights Ive spend there nothing ever woke me up. My mother who is a very light sleeper didn't mind the ''noises'' as well, we couldnt hear a thing. The room was very small (compared to american standard rooms) but hey it is Europe we cannot require a big room for a good price... The beds were comfortable and I actually liked the room, even though it was small I felt comfortable in there and thats all that really matters. The bathroom was indeed very small as well and very simple, but very well cleaned and thats all that really matters to me! One thing about the bathroom that actually made me laugh was the size of the sink, so tiny.. but that was not big deal at all. There is no mini bar in the room, that was one thing that actually surprised me! BUT again that was not a problem, at least not for us... we placed the beverages next to the window, if you intend to go to london in the winter time I recommend you to do the same, it actually works! The staff (at least to us) were always very helpful, patient and attentive, I have nothing against them at all.. And about the breakfast, I do not know about it, cause I did not eat breakfast in the hotel at anytime. But my father actually tried it and thought the food was alright, my mother on the other hand despised everything about it.. I think it depends a lot.. but according to my father the food was the traditional english breakfast.. so i guess it depends of how demanding you are.. In general i think the hotel was great, better than what I expected.. It is well located (1 min walk or maybe less) from the Paddington station and also close to bus stops.. The hotel was well cleaned and the staff were very helpful. Yes I do recommend this hotel to people who are not so into luxury things. And yes I would stay there again ! Hope this review can help someone! :)

Reviews.Title: “As good as a hotel twice the price”
Reviews.Author: Neil W
Reviews.Content: Having spent a long time looking online for a good budget hotel around Central London I'm glad I chose this one. It is clean (including the shower room), the television (Freeview) works, and the breakfast (buffet Full English) is very good indeed. Turning on the heating that worked well and quickly too. Having stayed in grotty so called hotels twice the price of this one I can say that this was more four star than three. The room I stayed in was small but it served the purpose for an overnight stay. My room was right at the front of the hotel so there was some traffic noise but if that kind of thing bothers you and you don't use ear plugs for any hotel you stay in then well that's your problem. I also found the staff very helpful. Will stay again for any overnight stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Modestly priced, top location near Paddington station”
Reviews.Author: Gigabyte056
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not large, a bit noisy with the room adjacent to some kind of central heating. The hotel is priced according to what you get, a clean room with the required amenities. Only two gripes I had with the hotel were that the bathroom is not comfortable for use, meaning that it is quite small and seems to be designed poorly. the other issue is that breakfast is served from 7 am until 9 am, when on business in the city when would hope for breakfast to start a bit earlier. Wifi is supplied and works just fine (free of charge)

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel close to Paddington Station”
Reviews.Author: LuckyduckBristol
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value for a London Hotel. The location is great, just a couple of minutes from the station, off Praed Street with the entrance on London Street. A single room with breakfast was £64. The room was in the basement and though small was ensuite with room to hang clothes and very clean. The staff were very friendly, the breakfast was fine, cereal, toast, juice and hot buffet with the usual eggs, bacon, beans, sausage and toast. London Street has plenty of pubs, shops cafes and restaurants. If you want to be close to Paddington with everything you need on the doorstep this hotel will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just dont' book this hotel - Awful Awful Awful”
Reviews.Author: Lunar T
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude and arrogant. Nothing good to say about this hotel except its handy for Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “London Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: Good points-near to Paddington Station, near to restaurants and pubs, near to Hyde Park. Bad Points-Room G03-small and bijoux doesn't come close! Literally a shoe box right next to the main entrance and on the street noise all night long. The bathroom smells of drains, and no amount of perfume would disguise the smell. If you are offered this room-refuse! Breakfast was rushed. As soon as I finished my cereal, the bowl was whipped away, and I got the feeling having a leisurely breakfast was not something one should do. Would I stay again? No.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: hamrickpa
Reviews.Content: I was at the Castelton for 5 nights with three friends. We had two rooms on the top (4th) floor - one had a double bed and one 2-twins. The hotel has a lift which is not common. That made carrying luggage to the 4th floor so much easier. The rooms were clean. No overly fancy amenities but there were hair dryers, tea kettles, and electricity adapters in every room! Additionally, there is free Wi-Fi! The Castleton provided a full English breakfast (included) every morning. Although there was no variety, the food was consistent and good. The breakfast was served in the basement and the rooms down there smelled musty. I don't know that I would have been happy in those rooms because of the smell. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location (straight down from Paddington) cannot be beat! It was a short walk to/from the tube and this made getting out the city easy. If you are going to the Castleton expecting a Ritz Carlton - DON'T, you will be unhappy! If you go reading these reviews and understanding you are getting an affordable hotel in London you will be pleased. My friends and I would certainly visit the Castleton again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: kejamesShropshire
Reviews.Content: We struggled to book 2 nights in London for a family room during half term. I was a bit aprehensive about staying here after reading the reviews. We arrived at 12midday & we were allowed to check into our room straight away.We were disappointed that our room was on the lower ground floor so had no view whatsoever. However, the room was of an adequate size. It was clean & beds were comfortable. Yes, the bathroom was very small, but it had a toilet, sink & a very powerful shower, what more do you need! Hotel staff were all very helpful. Breakfast was hot & you could help yourself to as much as you liked. Excellent location, close to Paddington station. Restaurants & bars close by. We were able to leave our luggage after checking out. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: hmsg128
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Excellent location - very near to Paddington and eateries. Room size is typical for london for the price paid, including breakfast. Ok if you spend more of the day outside. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight or weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: S J C
Reviews.Content: We came for sightseeing and an evening at the theatre and booked for one mid-week night. Although our double room was small, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The shower 'pod' was very small but looked new, was very clean and everything worked. There were no unpleasant smells. The only thing we would have liked additionally would have been a second reading light for the other side of the bed. The room was on the fourth floor but there was a lift and although our window faced the street it wasn't noisy enought to disturb us. The staff were very pleasant, the breakfast was good and the location very convenient, just a short walk from the Paddington tube exit on Praed St., and plenty of local restaurants. The price seemed reasonable for central London, especially with the breakfast included and we would certainly consider staying again. Thank you Castleton.

Reviews.Title: “Very underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: BNord79
Reviews.Content: Good location in London, and although we expected a small room in London hotels this one was tiny. There wasn't enough room for our two bags, so we were constantly jumping over them to get to the bathroom. The furniture in the rooms was very dated and worn out, dark from lack of lighting and the tv wasn't tuned to most stations. The one small window in the room opened up onto the air conditioning system of the building next door, so we had to keep the window shut and rely on the air conditioning in the room, which took a while to get going. But what really made our stay terrible was that there was a noise every thirty minutes or so from some equipment in the hotel which we could not identify that sounded like drilling (although we're sure it wasn't) so we didn't get more than 30 minutes of continuous sleep all night. At one stage we asked for some assistance from front desk, but they looked at us blankly and we were told there was nothing they could do and that they would look into the issue tomorrow (after we had checked out - great). This hotel wasn't cheap either, and I really didn't feel we got value for money compared to other hotels we have stayed at in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location”
Reviews.Author: DallasMcB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The rooms are postage stamp small, but manageable, and we weren't planning to spend much time in the room. What you get is a decent price, by London standards, a hot breakfast (which saves a fair amount of time and money), and a 3-minute walk to Paddington tube and train station, which gets you anywhere in London. Had initially set my sights on staying in Mayfair for "convenience", but most prices were more than we were wanting to pay. We acquiesced to friends traveling with us and accepted the Castleton. Have no regrets..... and more $ in our pockets. Front desk was helpful and pleasant, beds were comfortable. Hotel is also 1/2 block from one of the Big Bus Tours stops. If you can stand the shock of how small most rooms are, this is a great place to stay. I will add that the other 2 couples traveling w/ us had rooms slightly more spacious than ours, so guess they do vary a little. We were all on 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful and I am not hard to please”
Reviews.Author: louloum_11
Reviews.Content: Seriously, take your money and go elsewhere. This is by far the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. £129 for a 'double' room that you could not walk down the sides of the bed in. Broken TV, rooms that are dirty, unkempt, suffocating boxes (really, see the photo of our lamp...this is how much they care for the facilities). The 'bathroom' was literally the same size as my pine wardrobe. A sealed plastic unit dropped into the room, where you can wash your feet in the shower whilst sitting on the loo. Think of festivals and you're there. It smelled overwhelmingly of urine and cheap plastic. We changed rooms once, then gave up and went out. Please, please don't make our mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Lesleymelville
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us a room so small that 2 suitcases could not be opened at the same time. Tiny step up hole in the wall bathroom which smelled of urine. We paid for one night but we went to another hotel. Very disappointed Do not go here.

Reviews.Title: “A single room booking is a risk”
Reviews.Author: PietreLondon
Reviews.Content: It helps if you are petite and have little or no luggage when you book a single room in this hotel. The room was so small that the toilet was at the end of the bed partitioned only by a partial screen - I am surprised the public health authorities allow it. It was also in the basement so there was minimal natural light as it was necessary to have the screen/curtains closed to avoid workmen/staff seeing you when they came down the outside steps. The next single room I stayed in at a higher price was OK but still small and opposite the lift entrance so it could be noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and excellent service - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: DiaMiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to Paddington Station, which makes it easy to travel to all the best known places in London. Rooms are small but spotlessly clean with comfortable beds. Courteous, very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Compact but Complete”
Reviews.Author: microsizzle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in late august this year on a solo trip. I stayed in room 307 (I believe across from the elevator). I was staying in a single so was not surprised when it was pretty small but what it lacked in space it made up for in comfort and cleanliness(at least until I unpacked my stuff). While only a single bed it was nicely appointed with crisp sheets and a good pillow. I had a nice window looking down over a few pubs and on down to Paddington station which was cool for people watching when jet lag made you sleep for weird hours I had an air conditioner above my head for when it got too hot in the room which was a good touch. On the wall at the foot of my bed was a flat screen TV mounted another nice touch. I never turned it on so can't tell you if there was any cable TV or whatever. WIFI was good - nothing more to say there- tea and coffee facilities for that end of evening fix! The bathroom was very small but given the space available to use I thought it had every thing I needed hair dryer, shower toilet etc. Breakfast was pretty good with loads of bacon and scrambled eggs along with everflowing tea which was a good way to start the day - there was also a great cafe across the road (Mimmo's I think it was called). The reception was 24 hours which for me was very handy as I had strange hours to keep. The receptionists were always cheerful and helpful. They gave you your key attached to a huge string pom pom thing so you never forgot to hand it back which was unusual. The hotel is very handy to the tube, Paddington station, is close to the canals for that early morning run. All round good location in western side of central London For the money I thought it was a great place to stay. A testament to this was when I discovered I had an extra night in London I was pretty disappointed to discover I couldn't stay there as they were booked solid.. Based on the single room I would stay there again if travelling solo and based on the cleanliness i would stay there again if traveling in a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & convenient”
Reviews.Author: LondonLinda1
Reviews.Content: Many of the posters complain about the rooms being small. We had room 206 (a twin), and though it was not huge, it was certainly adequate and spotless. Our only complaint was the noise level. The room doors are very close together in a little alcove, and when people come and go it's very loud. The doors also bang shut, and should have some felt put around them. The breakfast was fine - fried or scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon and baked beans, orange juice and coffee or tea. You could also get cereal. There was enough food to hold you over until lunch. The best feature of the hotel is the location. Literally 3 minutes walk to Paddington. This was the reason we chose the hotel, and it was wonderful not to have to schlep through the underground with our bags on the way to the airport. There are many restaurants and pubs on the street and in the area where you can get lunch or dinner. We had lunch at the restaurant across the street (in the Indigo Hotel) and it was very good. We did have a rude shock when checking out. We had used a pre-paid phone card to make calls back to the US, and when we checked out there was an additional 35 pounds added to the bill for phone calls. The explanation given was that we had called 800 numbers - I thought when using a phone card the calls were only 2p per minute - future guests be aware of the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “OK for night stay”
Reviews.Author: smkumaar
Reviews.Content: Very tiny rooms. Only advantage is very near to Paddington station. Staff was very good. They should give some more movie channels. Free WIFI is advantageous. Breakfast room is very conjusted. Breakfast is below average. But it is English breakfast. Some friuts should be included. We can hear the next room conversation. Next time I willlook for another hotel. I will not stay here. Not worth for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: 187147George
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly establishment - three star accomodation - rooms are not huge but the service is superb - Aircon available and a full English breakfast is included and free WiFi available. Lift to all floors. Shower size is " limited" ...not for those of "a certain size"!! I have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel. If arriving from Heathrow this Hotel is 500 metres from Paddington Heathrow Express station

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & great price!”
Reviews.Author: OZMARKY
Reviews.Content: I read through many accommodation types and reviews when it came to selecting a place to stay on my recent trip to London. Having stayed previously in another hotel on Sussex Gardens (which was extremely disappointing), I was a bit dubious about all the hotels in this particular part of town. I expected that they would all be run the same way. But the reviews overall for Castleton Hotel were favourable. Thus I decided to book it. The Castleton Hotel´s best attribute is it´s location. It´s conveniently close to Paddington Station and an assortment of shops, bars and eateries. And only a few stops away from both Oxford and Piccadilly Circus Stations, and the West End theatres and restaurants. The staff at this establishment were friendly, welcoming and courteous. Always saying hello and goodbye/night. And that to me is always a nice start or end to the day. As I´ve discovered on my numerous trips to London, it´s not common to be helped with tour, theatre, restaurant, or directions assistance. So I can´t judge this hotel in that department. But free advice in that area would´ve earnt bonus points. The hotel on outside appearance was tidy and presentable. With the foyer/entrance area being neat and presentable. The only downside was getting in the elevator (the elevator floor could´ve been vaccumed a little). Upon reading previous reviews on the Castleton, I´d read that some rooms and bathrooms were rather small. In relation to mine this was an understatement! Granted I was expecting to deal with this, the smallness of my room turned out to be the only real disappointment of my stay. There was hardly room to swing a cat (as the expression goes)! Luckily for me I was not planning to waste any non sleeping/showering time in my room. And London is one of the geatest cities to entice you outdoors. Before heading outdoors, breakfast needed to be eaten. This was included in the price. It was standard cereal, toast, eggs (scrambled or fried), bacon and juice or tea/cofee. All you really need. The breakfast room was very small and compact. It was 2 floors under ground. And there were no windows or views. A touch disappointing. Thus I only ate downstairs once during my 4 night stay. The eating hours were between 7-9am. Which while your travelling can be just a bit early. Just one hour more would´ve been more flexible. Most hotels I have stayed at in London have had breakfasts between 7-10am. Much traveller friendly! Apart from that, I had a pleasant stay. And would return without hesitation. Great price!

Reviews.Title: “not really a hotel, more of a guest house..”
Reviews.Author: Mollie1961
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful and appeared to be very attentive to guests. My room was tiny, ok for a sightseeing trip where one doesn't need to use it during the day. As a previous reviewer said, there was a smell of sulphur from the bathroom, odd smell, maybe due to lack of proper ventilation. Bed linen spotless. Towels could be updated. Room cleanliness was A1. There is no residents' lounge or sitting room, no bar. TV channels in bedroom were not functioning adequately, only 5 channels. Overall, this is a guest house at best, and location is good for Tube and seeing London. Appears to be a safe area also.

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: lilia s
Reviews.Content: The room we were offered was very small, the carpet looked dirty with lots of stains and also the TV was faulty and after telling reception no one came to fix it or offer us another room. For the price we paid (£154) may as well book somewhere else so you can get better value for your money, thank God was only one night.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: NgfamilyHK
Reviews.Content: The family stayed in 2 rooms at Castleton for a night. The twin room was quite small but the triple room where we were upgraded was rather spacious for two people. The rooms were very clean with necessary facilities provided. The free wi fi worked very well and the full English breakfast was adequate. The reception staff was friendly and helpful and as we had to leave for a few days to another country, we requested for luggage storage so that we need not carry too much stuff around. We had to pay 5 gbp per bag and it sounded expensive but could really save our trouble and the luggage room was a locked one. The location of the hotel is really very convenient; just a few minutes walk from the Paddington Station. The air-conditioning is also a bonus in hot weather. The room rate if booked early can be a good deal, otherwise, it is quite expensive. Will consider staying in this hotel the next time we go to London.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean...”
Reviews.Author: Karen31367
Reviews.Content: We were tired after hauling around luggage from Heathrow to the train station and walking to the hotel (not a far walk from Paddington). The hotel staff was friendly and we were given our key immediately. The room was very small (including the shower), but both room and bathroom were very clean. We were told that we would be on the 1st floor (I have very bad knees) but there were a few steps up here and there before we got to the room. The breakfast (included with the room) was very good. If you are prepared for the size of the room, you won't mind staying in this hotel. It is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy58702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Castleton in July 2011 and found the hotel clean and modern, and closeby Paddington which provides the Heathrow Express train plus a tube stop that makes it convenient for traveling around London. All in all a great stay. We recommend the Castleton!

Reviews.Title: “Too small....for a family of four in one room...like being in a caravan!”
Reviews.Author: KirstM
Reviews.Content: Sorry, we won't choose here again in a hurry for a family in one room...way too small. We were in basement. Was a bit of a maze put too many rooms in a hotel I believe and charges too much for it! Glad only wanted a bed for one night for 4! Larger bathrooms in a caravan! Not much choice for breakfast...! Smelt of paint, not good in basement. Ok if want hotel near Paddington or Lancaster Gate!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but missing little touches that would make a perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Umaisarah
Reviews.Content: We had the 4-bedded room which was a nice size for our family of 2 adults and 3 tween girls. The bathroom was huge for the hotel's standards. Everything was spotlessly clean. Location is fantastic, just a few minutes walk from Paddington which connects to Heathrow in 15 minutes. Paddington has a few impt tube lines running through it so it was convenient connecting to various parts of London. A stop for the hop-on and hop-off bus was also nearby. Breakfast was nothing fantastic but the service by the waitress was very good. Free wifi is a great bonus. Missing touches ? There was no hooks at all in the bathroom for us to hang our clothes.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: swarovski7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last night. Was in a predicament as I missed my train out of London and also lost my wallet. Luckily i had £90 on me which was enough to get a room at this hotel. Room was extremely small. If you are fat, you wont physically be able to get in. Was clean, Worst thing was the TV, mounted in a way which makes it impossible to watch in bed. Breakfast was OK, probably ate enough calories to kill a horse.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: JTW07
Reviews.Content: First, the minuses. As is the case, apparently, with most London hotels, the room was small. The bathroom was very small. If you are oversized or have large amounts of luggage, this hotel is not really for you. But... It is a three minute stroll from Paddington Station - the terminus for the Heathrow Express and a stop on the main subway line to almost anywhere. It is on a street full of little restaurants, relatively inexpensive (for eating) pubs, and fast food places (MacDonalds, Burger King, KFC, as well as some English equivalents. Across the street and up a block is an inexpensive Internet location. There's a convenience store across the street if you, as we, like to save money by making a picnic lunch. Croissants three for a pound. (or you can go up a couple blocks and around the corner to the bakery and get one croissant for 1.3 pounds). Our room was clean and quiet. Breakfast was standard eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, cereal, juice - but well prepared. Very cheerful and friendly staff, both in the breakfast room and at the desk. We dealt with four different desk clerks and all were friendly, cheerful and extremely helpful. The price is moderate. There are at least 20 other similar hotels within one minute if you wanted to shop around. We were happy where we were and stayed. And would go there again if we ever go back to London.

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a clean place to sleep ... this will do”
Reviews.Author: bojantercon
Reviews.Content: I mainly wanted to be close to Paddington Station, so that I could get to Heathrow fast and was not planning to be in my room other than at night. Given those requirements, the room was fine. Our ground floor room was very small, with barely any space around the bed ... let alone for 2 large suitcases. The window offered a view of the air con well, with a sliver of sky high above. Got to say though, that there was no noise pollution. Bathroom was funky ... a plastic capsule that seemed to have been inserted into the room. It was basic but provided everything you needed: toilet, small sink and small shower with good water pressure. Was like a bathroom on a boat. If you plan to be out and about, you don't require anything fancy and are staying only for a few days, this place will do.

Reviews.Title: “Can not reccomend this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: dand1031
Reviews.Content: Extremely rude front desk staff, horrible hotel room, and the bathroom is a modular unit! The bathroom felt like you were on a ship-creaking and swaying floor.. And the price for this place is outrageous! Stay across the street at the Westpoint. Hotel. I usually stay there, but they were full. I will NEVER use the Castleton Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good option for London Zone 1”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Sobrinho
Reviews.Content: Stay in London Zone 1 means to be close to all the main sightseeing attractions. The hotel is really close to one of the main Subway stations, Paddington, which ensures a really easy walk around London. The room is fair, but the bathroom is incredible small. I mean REALLY small. bear in mind that I'm 1.92m with 84kg, so, not a large person and every time I hit my elbows on the wall during shower. Even with this minor issue, the staff is very nice. Breakfast could vary from time to time...after 04 days eating the same thing I went to the street to have it. The street where the hotel is located hides two treasurer: almost in front, there's another white hotel, with a cool Bar that serves an amazing Porch. Almost on the corner going towards Paddington St, there's an Arabic restaurant, ask for the Sawara and enjoy London City! Hotel has yet free WiFi connection that works quite fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LoobzD
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable two night stay at the Castleton. Pleasantly pleased as really wasn't sure what we would arrive to according to previous Trip Advisor comments.Castleton Hotel is ideally located within a three minute walk from Paddington Tube St. Arrived at hotel before check in time - but luckily hotel holds your luggage for you (upon arrival and on departure day too) and there is a nice friendly pub across the road (the sussex arms) which is appreciated after a long days travelling. On entering the room, i was slightly taken aback at how small the room and ensuite were, but honestly, it didn't prove to be a problem. At the end of the day, any one traveling to London doesn't have time to stay indoors no matter how big or small you room is. The hotel room and bathroom were cleaned to a very high standard and were serviced daily with towels being replaced and general tidying up being done. Room had the basics which you need (TV, bed, hanging space for clothes, soap, shampoos etc but no Tea/Coffee tray) I asked at reception if we could have two cups of tea, and were were provided with kettle, milk, tea and cups etc without any grumbles - which was greatly appreciated!!. Our room (g02) was situated on ground floor paralel to the busy main road, but we had a very peaceful nights sleep - honestly didn't hear a thing until my alarm clock in the morning. Modern and clean decor throughout hotel with some bedrooms being in the basement along with the breakfast room - there is a lift..Breakfast was basic, but again, did the job - two types of cereal, Tea/Coffee, toast, orange juice and selection of cooked items. No bar/restaurant but plenty of eateries/pubs nearby .Positive and helpful staff who are there for your needs 24/7. Only negative comment - book your own taxis if required (we asked at reception if they could book one, which they did, but got the feeling it was maybe a friend who just took us to our destination - didnt know where our destination was, and charged us double the fare compared to the black cab we took home (which had a meter)!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic rooms, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MissB_11
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Castleton for convinience to Hyde Park as we needed to be in the Park late for a charity event. The Castleton was 10 mins walk through what looked to be a safe well lit area. Staff were very helpful and accomodating when we wanted to leave our bags before check in; the rooms, although small, were spotless and the beds were comfortable. Only downside was a bad nights sleep due to the road noise as our rooms were on the first floor although the noise didnt bother my friend so it is probably because i am a light sleeper. The price was fairly cheap compared to other small hotels in the area. If i need a room in London for a night i would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room but poor attention to customer needs - broken toilet seat caused accident”
Reviews.Author: jtk1406
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and clean, friendly staff, nice breakfast. Took a little while to check in as there was obviously a double booking, but to our delight we got a family room so were initially very pleased. Then I went to use the toilet and the seat was broken and placed in a position so it couldn't be noticed. I slipped off sideways and bashed my leg quite badly. Tried to ring down to reception to tell them, but the phone didn't work. Went down to the front desk and asked them please could they fix it as it is dangerous and I hurt myself - I was told it would be seen to while we went out exploring London. 5 hours later we returned and the seat was not fixed and the new shift manager said he thought it was. It had not even been looked at as it hadn't even been moved from the position it was left in when we went out. On check out the same shift manager who said he'd fix it said he couldn't do it so I asked for some discount and was offered none. "If you had asked yesterday I could have done", but yesterday he said it would be fixed and it wasn't!! Not impressed whatsoever. Not once was I asked to fill in an accident book either. I have checked other reviews and it seems there was another broken toilet review. Probably the same one but not been fixed. I suspect the double booking resulted in us being put in a room that clearly needed the work doing but "it will do" rather than upsetting a customer. Had it not been for that incident I would more than recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Earlsf211
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel with great location...Convenient. Close to the tube (1 block to Paddington) and other transport- bus lines. Very clean rooms..bathroom are a bit small. Walls are thin and can hear people talking in hallway/next door. Breakfast was great-lots of choices. Constantly replenished. Although can boring after 6 days :-), lots of other option/bars/fast-food/restaurant/convenience store within walking distance-1to3 blocks...

Reviews.Title: “I want my money back... and get your hands off my toast!!”
Reviews.Author: hometown_glory
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend in room 306. The room was very small and had two twin beds. Both bedside tables were battered, the door wouldn't shut on one of them leaving it in the way. The walls were knicked and the paint was chipped in the room. One of the framed artworks had the picture falling out of the matting. Windows and window ledges were dirty. This all gave me the distinct impression that no effort was put into upkeep or presentation. No bedside lights. No chairs, luggage stands or even hooks to put stuff on, I had to put everything on the floor. There was a closet, however it was small and located at the far end of the room which required walking around both beds to get to. Two other room entrances were near to us, and the doors were not designed to prevent loud slamming, which was disruptive. The flat-screen TV was mounted way too high on the wall, so that when sitting on the bed (the only place to watch the TV from) we couldn't see the picture well because we could not adjust the angle. All the images appeared dark, as the TV is meant to be viewed straight on. The carpet in the hotel is in a general grubby and off-putting condition. The breakfast is free, but mediocre with fatty, greasy bacon and sausages that have been sitting under the heat lamp for goodness knows how long. I opted for cereal and the muesli had peanuts in it, very odd. One of the servers rudely insisted upon removing our toast rack with one piece left in it (no idea why, as we were not finished), and when I resisted she removed the toast with her bare hand and put it on my plate. She then proceeded to set the tables grabbing the eating ends of the utensils, I will not die from this behavior, however it made me wonder what other health issues and good restaurant practices were being neglected. We reserved for three nights and had to pay for everything on check-in. When the hotel is so bad, you don't wonder why they want people to pay before they see their room. We wanted to check out after the first night because the place was in such disrepair. We were told cancellation required 48 hours notice. I was aware of this policy when I booked but felt that if the hotel was this dis-satisfactory to us, they might make an exception as a gesture of goodwill. I should have asked to speak to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie0808
Reviews.Content: So once you get over the sticker shock for hotels in London and then get over what you get for the exorbitant cost, you can then enjoy the charm and convenience of the Castleton Hotel. By far the best value in London (and trust me I looked around). This hotel was in a prime location – close to the underground and trains and walking distance to Hyde park. Our room was small of course and the bathroom even smaller– it was nicely decorated, clean, with a great view. The service at the hotel was great – housekeeping was awesome, free wireless, and breakfast is included. The breakfast can grow tiresome after 3 days of the same but it was good. The staff was welcoming and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware - Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: tinamm
Reviews.Content: Photos on website are very misleading ..... The rooms are TINY. (Much Smaller than London Standard) I literally fell off the bed when asleep and am no big person. No space to move around let alone with luggages Not even a chair in the room Jackets DONT FIT in the makeshift "wordrobe" Breakfast might be acceptable for just two times The young guy at reception doesnt like it when interrupting his youtube vids - totally useless. All other employees may have some attitude problems but try to help. Furniture is nice The all plastic bathroom was clean One minute from paddington station has lift free car spaces with pre booking has wifi - but not in basement / Breakfast room This is my opinion according to my experience - Strange room keys

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SEASIDEJOHN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December to do our Christmas shopping, the location was great just 5 mins walk to Hyde park and the nearest tube. There was a great pub right across the road which was lively! The staff were very friendly and helpful but we found the bedroom very small, we had a double room but only access to the bed from one side which isnt a major problem to us but to older people it could be, especially climbing from one side to the other to pay a visit during the night!! The breakfast was very good and you could help yourself to seconds. The bathroom was a modular unit, again very small but fit for purpose. In terms of value, it was cheaper than a premier inn & travel lodge for the same weekend but still slightly overpriced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Robjoly
Reviews.Content: Good spot at a reasonable price. Close to the Tube and bus routes. The hotel offers a hardy breakfast. The rooms are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options for the same price”
Reviews.Author: worldtouristfamily
Reviews.Content: Paddington is a great location to stay as the Heathrow express gets you straight there and the Paddington underground is on two of the major lines for the city. For accommodation there are a lot of options just outdo the station and the Castleton is certainly not the best. The good: great location The bad: tiny (and by that I mean miniscule) rooms Poor breakfast (despite having already paid for it we ended up eating out twice) Uncomfortable bed Daylight robbery charges for using the phone in your room even with a phone card! Overall the castleton is just not value for money when you can get better almost next door

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel like your home.”
Reviews.Author: LJJSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room L114 for 6 nights. Pros: Staff was extremely friendly. When i asked them questions about getting around in london, they tried their best to answer me. Location is perfect but finding the hotel at night is confusing. The room was longish and had space to place my luggages just next to my bed. Toiliet is spacious and provides toilietries. We were lucky that room L114 is just next to the breakfast room so we need not get up so early. The staff in the breakfast room was courteous and gave us proper service. The breakfast was excellent at Castleton. The food there was ready to be served and piping hot. The scrambled eggs and hotdog was my favourite. It gives me a homely feeling. Other hotels i stayed gives me cold scrambled eggs, but this hotel served eggs that are piping hot and scrumptious. The hotdog was huge and it fills up my stomach quickly. Location from heathrow airport to the hotel is easy. Just take heathrow connect / heathrow express. There are plenty of bus services from paddington bus stop to Marble Arch / Oxford Street. It was so easy for me to get to oxford street just one direct bus! The reception allow us to place our hand carry in the storage compartment for free after much negotiation. Cons: L114 has no remote control. There was no place to hang our clothes and towels while bathing. The hairdryer was spoilt. The queen sized bed in the corner was freezing cold. My parents complained about it. The key was huge and bulky. But it is still traditional. The phone charges is expensive! Other than that, there was no more cons. Castleton hotel always gives me a homely feeling and the lift, key was all so special! I never see such special lift before. The key is so traditional and funny! Fast food was easily located around the hotel. Try KFC it is fantastic and worth! I will miss London and Castleton!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump...”
Reviews.Author: herbie747
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 114. What a horrible place - it was a depressing basement room. Was booked in for 2 nights & checked out after 1 and found a new hotel. There was a huge draft coming in the window which I had to block with pillows, no toilet seat, nowhere in the bathrom to hang the towels, no remote for the TV and it was stuck on subtitles, room was freezing, AC turned on at 7am by itself, wardrobes had no doors. I complained & wanted to leave at 6pm the same day I checked in, and I even offfered to pay half price for the few hours I'd been there as I wanted to leave, but they refused. They did refund me for the 2nd night though. But I did have to pay for the first night , so I ended up staying because I was being charged either way. When I was checking out early the next morning, the guy on reception said "oh, change of plan - returning to Ireland early?" I said - "No, going to a new hotel" - he said "oh, was eveything okay" and I said "the room was a bit [--]" - and he wasn't even bothered asking what was wrong with it. Also - poor phone reception. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: bubblyblond
Reviews.Content: I have been going to London approximately 6x/year for the past 5 years. I have experienced several hotels on varying levels (1*-5*) and always come back to Castelton. The staff is amazing. So friendly and accommodating!! Location is central and a two minute walk to Paddington Station. Rooms are small compared to American rooms but that's normal for Europe. There is plenty of room for our luggage and to move about the room. Hotel is clean and in a safe area. Price is extremely reasonable and interior of the hotel is simply charming!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: whoopy001
Reviews.Content: Very bad hotel, poor rooms with bad beds to sleep in and a very smal, plastic prefab bath room ... even wors than a Formule 1 hotel but at full hotes price. Not price worthy.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, good breakfast, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GAT59
Reviews.Content: Make sure you take the Praed St exit from Paddington Station and you'll be within viewing distance of the hotel. There is a lift, the room we had was spotless, shower small but clean and worked well. We asked for and received more tea and milk without a problem. Breakfast was included and was substantial. We only had one night here after arrival in London but would be more than happy to stay longer and really make it a base for exploring. The area seems really vibrant and is readily accessible to many tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED - ROOM IS SMALLER THAN A CARAVAN”
Reviews.Author: Campbj
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 2 month trip to London, France and Italy and out of all our accommodation even in B & B's the room that we stayed in has got to be the smallest room of all. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we were aware that the rooms were going to be small but quite frankly our room was smaller than a caravan. The ensuite "caravan size cubicle" was so small that you had to dry off in the small space that was left in the room which was about 18inches. The only place to put your luggage was a single small chair which meant that you couldn't access the side of the bed that was closest to the window unless you jumped over the other person. There is no room even in the floor space to open your suitcase unless you put it on the bed. We stayed three nights and it was impossible to walk around each other when getting dressed etc. One had to sit in the bed while the other dressed. We tried to see the funny side of the situation and tried to make light of our predicament as it was the start of our vacation but in the end we were relieved to leave the hotel. The location was really good, the street was noisy but we accepted that this is London so we weren't too perturbed about it, but we had to close the windows in order to get some sleep. Breakfast was good, staff were very pleasant but we would never stay at the Castleton Hotel again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Strube
Reviews.Content: I had to go to London to a conference in Paddington area. I already had a bad experience in another hotel in Norfolk Square, so I was trying to be more careful and look something better in that area. Overall, I paid a couple of ten pounds more that my other stay, but was definitely worth it. The Castleton is not luxury, but comfortable. The room is clean and service is good. Breakfast is ok. The room and bathroom are small, but I've seen worse... In general, The Castleton has everything that one would expect from a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaifaToto
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and were satisfied. rooms are small but convinient with all neccesery facilities. shower is tint but if you face it with good sense of humor it quite a challenging experience if you know what i mean. breakfest is great , enough to fill your tummy untill noon but it would be a good idea to add cheese. for us its weird that breakfast includes a huge sausage but no cheese but its a coltural issue as well so ok. room was cleaned everyday, staff helpfull and friendly and we chose 4 floor so no noise from street. like mentioned, great location. thres a pub just across the street so you can drink a few pints just before bedtime without having to worry about how to get home. overall good experience! shai and anna peri

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and price”
Reviews.Author: Ron2310
Reviews.Content: Small rooms yes. But the location and price were very attractive. I found this hotel to be very clean and safe. I had a single room that I felt had everthing a solo traveler needed. Maid service daily, Breakfast each morning from 7 am to 9:30 am Just down the street is a grocery market. Pubs and food just across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, great location, basic, a tad noisy”
Reviews.Author: lacornuta
Reviews.Content: Very compact, little extra room to move, but the room is clean, offers complimentary breakfast (bacon, eggs, sausages, cereal and toast) and free wifi also a good thing if you (like us) had your own laptop. We had a room by the street which was a little noisy, esp with the bar directly opposite us, so don't stay here on weekends! I think I would stay here again, we can't reiterate enough that it was compact, but its reasonable and has what was necessary (eg kettle, hair dryer). Might invest in earplugs if we're staying on a Friday/Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Service sucks!”
Reviews.Author: SeanNg78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Castleton hotel recently, and the experience was very unpleasant. In addition to the small room, small lifts, confusing maze of rooms and noisy environment already mentioned by so many people, I had one more horrendous experience. We left our luggage with the hotel on the morning after we checked out, and when we came back to the hotel in the evening wanting to collect it, the hotel door was locked?! We rang ALL the door bells available outside, we called the hotel's number, and no one answered anything. After such a long time, a middle aged guy finally walked out from inside and opened the door for us, and he wasn't even apologetic! It was as if nothing has happened and we owed him a living. And mind him, we were supposed to go to the airport right after that. That is how this hotel can screw you up and yet be nasty to you after that. Go there at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Gooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights recently. We looked forward to our stay after reading all the good reviews about here on Tripadvisor, but what a disappointment we got. We booked a twin bed room, it was so small, you could hardly swing a cat in it, the ensuite was the size of a toilet on an aeroplane with a shower tray added on to it and the smell of urine in it was disgusting. Our room was to the front of the hotel and the noise was terrible, they also had scaffolding at the front and at around 5am the noise of workers on it was terrible. Now to the breakfast, we tried it the first morning, but not again!! The positives about this hotel is the proximity to Paddington Station and I must say the staff are very friendly, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and its not cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “small room but good value & good location”
Reviews.Author: seadragonking
Reviews.Content: Adequate room for single person, will be just about ok if 2. Bathroom / toilet is very tight, being on my own, I left the bathroom door open when in it otherwise I will find it hard to turn in there. Bed is on the small side, and I am not big. Room is clean and airy and bright. Room key is attached to a big chain - to stop you bringing key out I think. Breakfast - buffet but very limited variety, does have some hot food though. Breakfast room is squeezy and underground, no view. Lift is small. No other facility that I am aware of. Location - 2 min walk from paddington station and lots of shops / restaurants around - very convenient. Tariff - not cheap but for london standard, it is good value. Would recommend for single traveller or couples (although couples should look elsewhere for posh / romantic factor).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: sjdwelliott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two boys stayed here in early June. Although the hallways were a struggle to navigate with luggage, we really enjoyed our stay. We had a quad room in the basement right next to the breakfast room. We heard no noise from the floor above us or people coming and going from the breakfast room. In fact, we almost slept through breakfast both days of our stay because it was so quiet. We were prepared for small rooms and small bathrooms, so it was no surprise when we got to our room. Having been on cruises before we were used to small accommodations. The air conditioning was much appreciated since there was something of a heat wave during our stay in London. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel - very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: danc974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Castleton Hotel twice over the span of a week (separated by a weekend out of town) in two separate rooms. I had only just arrived in London, and having been here before chose the budget hotel option over a hostel. I stayed in two separate rooms, a single room and a double room. The single room was on the same floor as reception and looked out onto the street (at street level) which was a little weird. The room itself was quite small, but adequate for one person - plenty of room for luggage and to get around. I found the bathroom, while small, was quite nice and had been refurbished quite recently - it was not as small as I was expecting. This room was quite noisy in the evenings though because you heard people coming and going through the front door as it was literally on the other side of the wall from the bed. As I was getting over jetlag, it didn't concern me too much and the later you go to bed the less you will notice it. The double room that I had was on the 4th floor and had about the same amount of free floor space as the single room. Again, it was quite adequate for me but you might struggle if there was two people and two suitcases. The bathroom in this room was actually smaller than the single room and quite a bit older. I preferred the bathroom in the single room. This room was a lot quieter though. Breakfast: Food was ok - nothing to write home about, but the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed a little Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Mike_8530
Reviews.Content: Needing a spot near Paddington for an early morning flight out of LHR, I booked Castleton based on their availability & favourable reviews on Tripadvisor. The location is certainly convenient to the station, as well as the tube, but I'm not sure what else is around there, didn't have much time to explore. The room was small, but not overly so for a single. It had a discrete A/C unit, which worked nicely and is a rarity in a property such as this from what I understand. While the window didn't look out onto much, there was a good amount of noise filtering up from the street below until fairly late in the night. Light sleepers might find this problematic. The bathroom was a single-piece "drop-in" unit that felt about as big as that on an airplane, and I can't imagine anyone of larger proportions would even fit into the shower (which itself is not the best design - water seems to splash out everywhere). I found myself thinking I would have preferred a larger & better appointed shared bathroom to this tiny private one. While the place was pretty clean, there was a good-sized permanent stain on the carpet, some holes in the bedskirt, and a big tear on the chair upholestery. None of this was a huge problem, but when you're doling out £92/night, you'd think these things would be looked after. Then again, this is London. If it were cheaper, I would likely strongly consider staying here again when I'm in the area. As it stands, I think it's a tad overpriced for what it delivers on - but again, I have no experience staying in London hotels and perhaps this really is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to return here”
Reviews.Author: BearVillain
Reviews.Content: Although a little on the small side our room at the Castleton was cheerfully decorated, well equipped/kitted out and spotlessly clean. It represented excellent value for a stay in a nice part of London. The staff were also pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately Aston Villa couldn't match the same level of quality at Wembley :-(

Reviews.Title: “This hotel worked out great for us”
Reviews.Author: neatplaces
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way through London. We were flying through Heathrow and wanted to sight see on our way to and from Greece. The location is perfect as it is just a few blocks from Paddington Station where you can ride the Express or the Connect from Heathrow. You can ride the tube also, but you have to change trains and it is slow. The neighborhood is lovely too. Very close to Hyde Park and you can walk to many things from this location, or you can take the tube with several stations close by, plus the bus route with the red double deckers is two blocks away. We arrived in the morning and rode the cheaper Connect, then left our bags in the lobby since check in was not yet ready. Yes, the rooms are small and the bathroom too, but you're in London, you should not be spending much time in the room- go see the city! The breakfast is lovely here, with real plates and tablecloths and fresh food and they managed to make a basement a pleasant place to eat. The beds are very comfortable and the linens too. Even though the bathrooms are small, they are very efficient and you can set the water temperature in the shower before you turn on the water, hence very energy efficient. This hotel is freshly remodeled, so everything is clean and nice. Its a great value too. We stayed in another hotel also and it was similar, but more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jacq69
Reviews.Content: After reviewing lot's of hotels in the area my husband and myself decided on The Castleton primarily because it offered on site parking and to be honest for the money we weren't expecting more than just a bed and a quick breakfast in the morning. We travelled down from the Midlands on Sunday morning and decided to spend the day sightseeing so phoned the hotel to inform them that it was likely to be late evening when we arrived and we were assured everything would be ready whatever the time. We finally arrived at 8.00pm shattered and soaked (it threw it down just as we got to Trafalgar Square) and quickly parked right outside the door (there was a skip outside but it didn't affect access in any way) We were asked to pay up front which is no different to other places we have stayed and were asked to leave our car key on reception incase of emergencies and were shown where everything was and were given a key to room 305 on the 3rd floor, there is a lift but we chose to use the stairs, and braced ourselves for the usual budget room. Boy were we surprised, everything from the bedding to decoration was top quality, the quilt and pillows looked and felt as though you were the first to use them, the bed was firm but very comfy with no stray springs and there was 1 bedside table and a lovely side table and 2 chairs. There was plenty of wardrobe space complete with hangers, a tea tray for 2, a hairdryer, free toiletries and 2 lovely soft bathtowels! (these got replaced each morning when the room was cleaned and the bed made) We were amazed at what we were getting for the price. We both showered straight away to freshen up and yes it is a tiny capsule bathroom but it was powerfull hot and did the job, i didn't find it a problem at all and could move around quite freely. We then decided to go for a wander and check out the area, less than a minute away out the door and to the right we were on a busy street full of shops restuarants cafes and even a mcdonalds, by then we were starving and not knowing the area decided to ask the night receptionist for recommendations and he directed us to an indian restuarant where we had a lovely meal and drinks for less than £30, then shattered we decided to have an early night. As expected the bed was very comfy, the room was warm and the only noises we heard were from the pigeons sitting on the fire escape outside our window. Breakfast is served from 7am till 9am in a lovely room in the basement and there was plenty of choice, we started with cereal and fresh orange while our choice of either scrambled or fried egg was prepared and then helped oursleves to sausage bacon and beans from the hotplate, toast and tea or coffee was also served straight away. We spent all day Monday shopping and found everything within walking distance of the hotel, about 20 - 30 minutes away was oxford street, regent street and the british museum then after tea we found Park Lane and Harrods (open till 8pm) about the same distance away, but if you don't fancy walking Paddington tube is just minutes away from the hotel. We had to check out by 11am on Tuesday but the staff were very flexible and were happy for us to leave our car for a bit longer to go for a last walk before we headed to the Natural History Museum and then home. We paid £154 for 2 nights bed and breakfast in a double room and onsite parking and considered it excellent value, we asked to see a family room while we were there and were shown a room downstairs next to the breakfast room which was just as nice as the one we used but had a wet room and we will definately be booking in the next few weeks to come back with our teenage daughters and i for one can't wait it was a pleasure to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Oxf0rdGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February 2010 and thought the hotel was really good value for money. It's not easy to find somewhere in London for under £100 per night but to find somewhere for that price which is so close to central London is great. The staff were very pleasant and the hotel was clean and well looked after. The room and bathroom were small but with two of us in the room we managed just fine! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Copperfield27Rome
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here on business (solo woman) and have already booked for next trip. The hotel is freshly refurbished and was impeccably clean, staff always helpful and courteous and the location is excellent. Yes, the rooms are not large (are any in London?) and the bathrooms are tiny BUT the bed was comfy , the shower was powerful and the bathroom was spotless. Throw in nice toiletries, hairdryer, breakfast and a lift all for under £60 per room and this was one very happy guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: raegan131313
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here in September as part of a 4 week trip to Europe. This hotel was the most expensive even though we stayed in 3 or 4 stars in the main in Paris and Spain. Very clean, fantastic location, close to tube and bus stops. Only drawback was the bathroom - it was tiny. The shower - I couldn't extend my elbows out fully as they hit the sides of the shower. Not a bad breakfast. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest cheap London hotels”
Reviews.Author: ShaunR123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in November after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Friendly service, very close to Paddington station and a nice breakfast. Rooms are pretty small - bathroom is a capsule type affair without lots of space. However they are clean with comfortable beds and pillows. There is an air conditioner which also doubles up as a heater - which means you're always comfortable. Having stayed in plenty of nasty London hotels at a similar price, this is a refreshing change and I will be returning there in future. It's a shame more London hotels can't be like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at The Castleton”
Reviews.Author: ruz
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and two young adult daughters) stayed for 12 nights at the Castleton in December. Our rooms and bathrooms were small, but very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed breakfast--it was tasty and filling, and our servers were gracious. We found the staff very helpful. They gave us great tips on restaurants and shopping, and checked us in for our flights and printed our boarding passes for us when we checked out. The hotel's location is fantastic. We were a couple of blocks from Paddington Station, and were able to travel all over London on the Underground, as well as catch easy transportation two and from Heathrow. If we returned to London, we'd definitely stay at the Castleton again. We'll recommend it to friends, too. It was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay for the price, cracking location”
Reviews.Author: MRCOOP
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews on tripadvisor for the Castleton Hotel I decided to book for one evening prior to a flight from Heathrow the next day. On arrival I was greeted by a friendly gentlemen on reception and promptly booked in and guided to my room. The place although clean appeared to be a little old fashioned. Thankfully a lift has been fitted which appeared to be fairly new, useful considering I was a few floors up and had a large suitcase. I'd booked a single room and was glad to find the room I was allocated was in-fact a double room en suite. The room was a good size, it had recently been refurbished nicely with a lcd freeview tv on the wall and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was very small, one of those self contained units you sometimes get in B&B's fine for a quick shower and not much else. I had a decent nights sleep, no noise issues apart from guest noise that you would expect. Breakfast in the morning was much better than expected, full English was good but was not a proper full english just Bacon, Sausage, Egg & Beans. The staff were very attentive and certainly were not discourteous which is what I normally find in London Hotels! Overall for the price I thought the Castleton was great, a little quirky but clean, good staff and decent breakfast. Well worth booking yourself in for a day or two, probably best suited for the solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Arnie270
Reviews.Content: A few days before our trip to London I read that although tourism to England was down by 5% income from tourism was down only 1%. I can believe it because for anyone on dollars it is really really expensive! As Hotels are a major expense we had a very hard time finding something within the budget of a family of five but really lucked out be finding the Castleton a few steps from Paddington Station. Despite it being the cheapest place we found it left very little to be desired. While generally European hotel rooms are small by American standards the Castleton has a variety of room sizes. If you get there and are not satisfied we observed the hotel staff graciously changing a couples’ room to one that was larger. Besides the room being clean, adequate in size, relatively cheap, breakfasts reasonable and the hotel being in an amazingly convenient location the staff is an additional reason for choosing the Castleton. We’ve paid much more money for hotels and not encountered the caring and helpfulness given us by at least 5 different desk personnel. This doesn‘t mean that all had the same level of computer skills to help us with the Internet etc. but they all tried very hard to make our stay pleasurable. For example, waiting for our children to meet us in the lobby for our departure to Heathrow we were informed that they had hit a transportation problem and we wouldn’t be getting to the airport as early as we had hoped. On hearing this and seeing the anxious look on my wife’s face, the desk clerk, Ahmer (who had previously explained the cheapest way to get us to Heathrow) asked if we had e-tickets. When we said yes, within minutes he presented us with our boarding passes which meant we would have a much speedier check-in. Some tips: stay away from most of the restaurants between the Station and the hotel. Ask the staff where to eat around the hotel. Second London has become a transportation disaster. We had 5 various “diversions” which included getting on the tube and hearing the announcement that the station we wanted was closed! Buy the “Oyster” card – definitely cheapest way to travel and learn how to use the busses – while maybe not faster they sometimes were much more convenient and are cheaper than the tube. To sum up the Castleton Hotel – outstanding value for money.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain in London!”
Reviews.Author: souplady723
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel a 5 star review. I don't understand the lower ratings. I spent 6 nights at this hotel the last week of September. First of all, it is within walking distance from Paddington Rail (Heathrow Express) and Underground Stations. The room with a private bath was big enough and the bathroom was spotless. The English breakfast every morning was amazing and the service very friendly and helpful in the restaurant. The fellows at the front desk were VERY helpful and cordial to all. I would go back in a nanosecond. My rate was about $90 US dollars a night. You can't stay at the YMCA for that and they don't include a full breakfast. I have been to London 6 times over the years and this is one of the nicest if not the nicest place I have stayed. I have paid much more but this hotel far surpassed the more expensive ones. Ask for a room at the back--it was very quiet!I would recommend this hotel and know you would enjoy your stay. During my stay everything worked and I had absolutely no problems. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Lost it a bit”
Reviews.Author: luxurydiva
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Castleton and the way they have now done the bathrooms has lost it for me. They are just too small for comfort. Tiny towels too. The dining room is so cramped you can hardly move around and the food has deteriorated badly. We paid for full breakfast but they were short of bacon on one morning. Ho tomatoes or mushrooms on offer and horrid bread for the toast. Service was fine. Its clean enough (despite ongoing renovations)but prices elsewhere have come down and the Castleton is no longer the great value it once was

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mrwilco
Reviews.Content: great breakfast, flat screen TV, individually controlled AC, large modern lift, clean modern compact bathroom, nice toiletries, short three block walk to Paddington Station

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: dbid22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days and were very impressed with the location. They were obviously in the middle of some updates/renos but were very tidy about it. Our room was clean and the bathroom was very clean. The only downfall was there wasn't wifi, but there was internet access in the lobby. The front desk man informed us that they were planning on having wifi within the month. The breakfast was good, served hot and quick. I would imagine it would get tiring after a while but for a couple of days it was a great way to start the day. We would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “staff and breakfast were good, the room was less than expected”
Reviews.Author: BigAlks
Reviews.Content: The staff and breakfast were very good at the Castleton, and the location was good. The room we had was not particularly clean, was very worn and there was mold in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to Visit London”
Reviews.Author: NaNa_Ast
Reviews.Content: My stay at the castleton hotel was very nice. The double Room was small, but for only two persons was perfect. The room and the bathroom very clean and confortable, they cleaned the hotel all the days. We arrived at the hotel 3 hours before the check in and we left our lugage at the reception, we went to the city and then we was returned at the hotel and they gave us our room at 13.00 pm. All the 7 days the room was clean and they changed the towels all days. The room had one double bed, one closet, one table with two chairs and a TV screen wich had 5 chanels (all in english). The bathroom had a wc, washbasin and shower (They gave us shampoo, soap for the body and soap for the hands). The Staff was very nice and they didn't speak Spanish but they can understand us. The air conditioning didn't work (It was out of order) but in the room was a ventilator who was enough. The breakfast room had diferent tables and it near of the reception. The waitress was very nice and the breakfasts contained egg (scramble or fried), sausage, bacon, toast, hot chocolate or coffee or tea, cereals and orange juice. In resume, The Castleton Hotel is a very great place to stay in London. At only 3 minutes walking the Paddington tube and rail Station (circle, barkerloo, district and hammersmith and city lines) and 5 minutes walking to the Lancaster Gate tube station ( central line). The price is perfect and the room, staff and breakfast is great to stay only for some hours at the day (Bed and Breakfast). If I will return at London, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ownership changed!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetgypsy
